intro: Isolepis steudelii, commonly known as the common spike-rush, is a perennial grass-like plant native to wetland and marshy environments. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and other similar plants. The plant has cylindrical, often spiky stems that are typically green or reddish in color. Its small, scale-like leaves are arranged in dense clusters around the stem. Isolepis steudelii plays an important ecological role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
